title: Black Forest Cake II
description: Indulge in this classic Black Forest Cake II, a luscious chocolate layer cake soaked in kirschwasser and layered with sweet cherry filling and fluffy whipped cream. Its rich flavors and moist texture make it a perfect centerpiece for any celebration or cozy gathering.
ingredients: 2 (14 ounce) cans pitted Bing cherries, drained
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottoms of two 8 inch round pans with parchment paper circles.
Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside.
Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract until well combined.
Alternately beat in the flour mixture and buttermilk until just combined.
Pour batter evenly into the prepared pans.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool cakes completely, then remove parchment paper.
Cut each cake layer in half horizontally to make 4 layers total.
Sprinkle each layer evenly with 1/2 cup kirschwasser.
In a medium bowl, cream butter until light and fluffy.
Add confectioners' sugar, a pinch of salt, and brewed coffee; beat until smooth. If too thick, add a few teaspoons of cherry juice or milk.
Spread one-third of the buttercream filling on the first cake layer, then top with one-third of the drained cherries.
Repeat spreading filling and cherries on the next two layers.
In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to stiff peaks.
Beat in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1 tablespoon kirschwasser.
Frost the top and sides of the assembled cake with the whipped cream mixture.
Create chocolate curls by using a potato peeler on the semisweet chocolate square and sprinkle over the cake as garnish.
tips: For best results, ensure the cakes are completely cooled before slicing and assembling to prevent crumbling. Use fresh, high-quality kirschwasser for authentic flavor. When whipping cream, chill your bowl and beaters for stiffer peaks. Avoid overmixing the batter to keep the cake tender.

This cake is a sensory delight with its rich textures and harmonious flavors, perfect for making any occasion memorable.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 2 hours
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for celebrations, holidays, and special events
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Classic combination of chocolate, cherries, and cream that never goes out of style

structured_content.content: This recipe was submitted by Valinda, whose family gatherings always featured this cake as a centerpiece. The blend of kirschwasser and cherries evokes warm memories of festive moments shared with loved ones.

• Main ingredient: High-quality unsweetened cocoa powder and all-purpose flour create the perfect tender yet rich chocolate cake layers.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Kirschwasser adds authentic cherry brandy flavor, while vanilla extract enhances the overall aroma.
  • Supporting ingredients: Buttermilk adds moisture and tenderness; Bing cherries provide natural sweetness and texture.
  • Equipment needed: Two 8-inch round cake pans, mixing bowls, electric mixer, parchment paper, and a potato peeler for chocolate curls.

Preparation:
Preheat your oven and prepare the pans with parchment paper. Sift dry ingredients to ensure even mixing. Cream shortening and sugar until fluffy, then incorporate eggs and vanilla. Alternate adding dry ingredients and buttermilk to maintain a smooth batter.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Bake the batter evenly in two pans until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool completely before slicing horizontally into layers. Sprinkle kirschwasser on each layer to infuse moisture and flavor.
Finishing Touches:
Prepare the buttercream filling and cherry layers, then whip the cream with vanilla and kirschwasser for frosting. Garnish with delicate chocolate curls for an elegant finish.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Ensure cakes are fully cooled before slicing to avoid crumbling.
  • Do not overbake; a clean toothpick test is key for moist layers.
  • Look for stiff peaks when whipping cream to achieve perfect frosting texture.
  • Store the cake refrigerated and consume within 2-3 days for best freshness.

structured_content.content: Sharing this cake with family and friends always brings joy and nostalgia. Its rich flavors and elegant presentation make it a beloved dessert that sparks conversation and compliments at every gathering.

Enhance the cake by adding a splash of cherry juice to the buttercream for extra fruitiness or sprinkle toasted almonds between layers for crunch. Experiment with dark chocolate shavings or a hint of cinnamon in the batter for a unique twist.

Serve slices with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or a glass of chilled cherry liqueur. This cake pairs beautifully with coffee or a light dessert wine, making it ideal for festive dinners or afternoon tea.

For a gluten-free version, substitute the flour with a gluten-free blend. Vegan adaptations can be made by using plant-based shortening, egg replacer, and coconut cream for frosting. Try fresh cherries instead of canned for a seasonal twist.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use room temperature ingredients for smoother batter and better rise.
  • Chill your mixing bowl and beaters before whipping cream for stiffer peaks.
  • Slice cake layers with a serrated knife for clean, even cuts.
  • Garnish with freshly made chocolate curls for a professional finish.
